images.caption: Figure 1:Overview of our proposed DreamO, which can uniformly handle commonly used consistency-aware generation control.

Figure 2:Visualization of cross-attention maps in subject-driven image generation. The first row shows results from a model trained without routing constraints, while the second row presents results from a model trained with routing constraints.
Figure 4:Visualization of cross-attention maps in some unseen scenarios.
Figure 5:The progressive training pipeline of our method. Left column shows the three training stages of our method. Right column shows the generation capability after the training of each stage.
Figure 6:The capability of our proposed DreamO in identity-driven image customization.
Figure 7:The capability of our proposed DreamO in subject-driven image customization.
Figure 8:The capability of our proposed DreamO in try-on image customization.
Figure 9:The capability of our proposed DreamO in style-driven image customization.
Figure 10:The ablation study of routing constraint in our proposed DreamO.
Figure 11:The ablation study of progressive training in our proposed DreamO.

Figure 12:The pipeline for data construction of style transfer. (Style 1, Style 2) constitutes a stylization training pair guided by style reference images. (Style 1, Style 2, Content Image) constitutes a stylization training triplet guided by both style reference images and a content reference image.
Figure 13:The pipeline for subject mask extraction from target images. The processing data includes X2I-Subject[54], Subject200K[47], and face data.
